131/**
132 * A Swing GUI component for displaying a {@link JFreeChart} object.
133 * <P>
134 * The panel registers with the chart to receive notification of changes to any
135 * component of the chart.  The chart is redrawn automatically whenever this
136 * notification is received.
137 */
138@SuppressWarnings("unused")
139public class ChartPanel extends JPanel implements ChartChangeListener,
140        ChartProgressListener, ActionListener, MouseListener,
141        MouseMotionListener, OverlayChangeListener, Printable, Serializable {
142
143    private ChartPanelProduct chartPanelProduct = new ChartPanelProduct();
144
145        /** For serialization. */
146    protected static final long serialVersionUID = 6046366297214274674L;
147
148    /**
149     * Default setting for buffer usage.  The default has been changed to
150     * {@code true} from version 1.0.13 onwards, because of a severe
151     * performance problem with drawing the zoom rectangle using XOR (which
152     * now happens only when the buffer is NOT used).
153     */
154    public static final boolean DEFAULT_BUFFER_USED = true;
155

157    public static final int DEFAULT_WIDTH = 1024;
158

160    public static final int DEFAULT_HEIGHT = 768;

163    public static final int DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH = 300;
164

166    public static final int DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT = 200;
167
168    /** The default limit above which chart scaling kicks in. */
169    public static final int DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH = 1024;
170
171    /** The default limit above which chart scaling kicks in. */
172    public static final int DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT = 768;

227    // default modifiers for zooming, private to avoid constant inlining,
228    // publicly available through getDefaultDragModifiersEx()
229    private static final int DEFAULT_DRAG_MODIFIERS_EX;
230
231    // mask for all modifier keys to check for
232    private static final int MODIFIERS_EX_MASK =
233            InputEvent.SHIFT_DOWN_MASK |
234            InputEvent.CTRL_DOWN_MASK |
235            InputEvent.META_DOWN_MASK |
236            InputEvent.ALT_DOWN_MASK;
237
238    static {
239        int dragModifiers = InputEvent.CTRL_DOWN_MASK;
240        // for MacOSX we can't use the CTRL key for mouse drags, see:
241        // http://developer.apple.com/qa/qa2004/qa1362.html
242        String osName = System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase();
243        if (osName.startsWith("mac os x")) {
244            dragModifiers = InputEvent.ALT_DOWN_MASK;
245        }
246        DEFAULT_DRAG_MODIFIERS_EX = dragModifiers;
247    }
248
249    /**
250     * The standard mouse button modifiers for alternative drag operations.
251     * There are two kinds of mouse drag operations: pan and zoom.
252     * To distinguish between them, one needs to require modifier keys
253     * to be held down during the dragging.  However, some modifiers
254     * may not be usable on all platforms.  For example, on Mac OS X
255     * it is impossible to perform Ctrl-drags or right-drags, see
256     * <a href="http://developer.apple.com/qa/qa2004/qa1362.html">http://developer.apple.com/qa/qa2004/qa1362.html</a>.
257     * This function returns a non-zero modifier usable for any platform:
258     * Alt for Mac OS X, Ctrl for other platforms.  It is recommended
259     * to use these modifiers for one operation, and zero modifiers for
260     * the other.
261     *
262     * @return modifiers mask, as in {@link InputEvent#getModifiersEx()}
263     * @see #setPanModifiersEx(int, int)
264     * @see #setZoomModifiersEx(int, int)
265     * @see #setDefaultPanModifiersEx(int)
266     * @see #setDefaultZoomModifiersEx(int)
267     */
268    public static int getDefaultDragModifiersEx() {
269        return DEFAULT_DRAG_MODIFIERS_EX;
270    }

432    /**
433     * Constructs a panel that displays the specified chart.
434     *
435     * @param chart  the chart.
436     */
437    public ChartPanel(JFreeChart chart) {
438        this(chart, DEFAULT_WIDTH, DEFAULT_HEIGHT,
439            DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH, DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT,
440            DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH, DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT,
441            DEFAULT_BUFFER_USED,
442            true,  // properties
443            true,  // save
444            true,  // print
445            true,  // zoom
446            true   // tooltips
447        );
448
449    }
450
451    /**
452     * Constructs a panel containing a chart.  The {@code useBuffer} flag
453     * controls whether or not an offscreen {@code BufferedImage} is
454     * maintained for the chart.  If the buffer is used, more memory is
455     * consumed, but panel repaints will be a lot quicker in cases where the
456     * chart itself hasn't changed (for example, when another frame is moved
457     * to reveal the panel).  WARNING: If you set the {@code useBuffer}
458     * flag to false, note that the mouse zooming rectangle will (in that case)
459     * be drawn using XOR, and there is a SEVERE performance problem with that
460     * on JRE6 on Windows.
461     *
462     * @param chart  the chart.
463     * @param useBuffer  a flag controlling whether or not an off-screen buffer
464     *                   is used (read the warning above before setting this
465     *                   to {@code false}).
466     */
467    public ChartPanel(JFreeChart chart, boolean useBuffer) {
468
469        this(chart, DEFAULT_WIDTH, DEFAULT_HEIGHT, DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH,
470                DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT, DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH,
471                DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT, useBuffer,
472                true,  // properties
473                true,  // save
474                true,  // print
475                true,  // zoom
476                true   // tooltips
477                );
478
479    }
480
481    /**
482     * Constructs a JFreeChart panel.
483     *
484     * @param chart  the chart.
485     * @param properties  a flag indicating whether or not the chart property
486     *                    editor should be available via the popup menu.
487     * @param save  a flag indicating whether or not save options should be
488     *              available via the popup menu.
489     * @param print  a flag indicating whether or not the print option
490     *               should be available via the popup menu.
491     * @param zoom  a flag indicating whether or not zoom options should
492     *              be added to the popup menu.
493     * @param tooltips  a flag indicating whether or not tooltips should be
494     *                  enabled for the chart.
495     */
496    public ChartPanel(JFreeChart chart, boolean properties, boolean save,
497            boolean print, boolean zoom, boolean tooltips) {
498
499        this(chart, DEFAULT_WIDTH, DEFAULT_HEIGHT,
500             DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH, DEFAULT_MINIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT,
501             DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_WIDTH, DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_DRAW_HEIGHT,
502             DEFAULT_BUFFER_USED, properties, save, print, zoom, tooltips);
503
504    }
505
506    /**
507     * Constructs a JFreeChart panel.
508     *
509     * @param chart  the chart.
510     * @param width  the preferred width of the panel.
511     * @param height  the preferred height of the panel.
512     * @param minimumDrawWidth  the minimum drawing width.
513     * @param minimumDrawHeight  the minimum drawing height.
514     * @param maximumDrawWidth  the maximum drawing width.
515     * @param maximumDrawHeight  the maximum drawing height.
516     * @param useBuffer  a flag that indicates whether to use the off-screen
517     *                   buffer to improve performance (at the expense of
518     *                   memory).
519     * @param properties  a flag indicating whether or not the chart property
520     *                    editor should be available via the popup menu.
521     * @param save  a flag indicating whether or not save options should be
522     *              available via the popup menu.
523     * @param print  a flag indicating whether or not the print option
524     *               should be available via the popup menu.
525     * @param zoom  a flag indicating whether or not zoom options should be
526     *              added to the popup menu.
527     * @param tooltips  a flag indicating whether or not tooltips should be
528     *                  enabled for the chart.
529     */
530    public ChartPanel(JFreeChart chart, int width, int height,
531            int minimumDrawWidth, int minimumDrawHeight, int maximumDrawWidth,
532            int maximumDrawHeight, boolean useBuffer, boolean properties,
533            boolean save, boolean print, boolean zoom, boolean tooltips) {
534
535        this(chart, width, height, minimumDrawWidth, minimumDrawHeight,
536                maximumDrawWidth, maximumDrawHeight, useBuffer, properties,
537                true, save, print, zoom, tooltips);
538    }
539
540    /**
541     * Constructs a JFreeChart panel.
542     *
543     * @param chart  the chart.
544     * @param width  the preferred width of the panel.
545     * @param height  the preferred height of the panel.
546     * @param minimumDrawWidth  the minimum drawing width.
547     * @param minimumDrawHeight  the minimum drawing height.
548     * @param maximumDrawWidth  the maximum drawing width.
549     * @param maximumDrawHeight  the maximum drawing height.
550     * @param useBuffer  a flag that indicates whether to use the off-screen
551     *                   buffer to improve performance (at the expense of
552     *                   memory).
553     * @param properties  a flag indicating whether or not the chart property
554     *                    editor should be available via the popup menu.
555     * @param copy  a flag indicating whether or not a copy option should be
556     *              available via the popup menu.
557     * @param save  a flag indicating whether or not save options should be
558     *              available via the popup menu.
559     * @param print  a flag indicating whether or not the print option
560     *               should be available via the popup menu.
561     * @param zoom  a flag indicating whether or not zoom options should be
562     *              added to the popup menu.
563     * @param tooltips  a flag indicating whether or not tooltips should be
564     *                  enabled for the chart.
565     */
566    public ChartPanel(JFreeChart chart, int width, int height,
567           int minimumDrawWidth, int minimumDrawHeight, int maximumDrawWidth,
568           int maximumDrawHeight, boolean useBuffer, boolean properties,
569           boolean copy, boolean save, boolean print, boolean zoom,
570           boolean tooltips) {
571
572        setChart(chart);
573        this.chartMouseListeners = new EventListenerList();
574        this.info = new ChartRenderingInfo();
575        setPreferredSize(new Dimension(width, height));
576        this.useBuffer = useBuffer;
577        this.refreshBuffer = false;
578        this.minimumDrawWidth = minimumDrawWidth;
579        this.minimumDrawHeight = minimumDrawHeight;
580        this.maximumDrawWidth = maximumDrawWidth;
581        this.maximumDrawHeight = maximumDrawHeight;
582
583        // set up popup menu...
584        this.popup = null;
585        if (properties || copy || save || print || zoom) {
586            this.popup = chartPanelProduct.createPopupMenu(properties, copy, save, print, zoom, this);
587        }
588
589        enableEvents(AWTEvent.MOUSE_EVENT_MASK);
590        enableEvents(AWTEvent.MOUSE_MOTION_EVENT_MASK);
591        setDisplayToolTips(tooltips);
592        addMouseListener(this);
593        addMouseMotionListener(this);
594
595        this.defaultDirectoryForSaveAs = null;
596        this.enforceFileExtensions = true;
597
598        // initialize ChartPanel-specific tool tip delays with
599        // values the from ToolTipManager.sharedInstance()
600        ToolTipManager ttm = ToolTipManager.sharedInstance();
601        this.ownToolTipInitialDelay = ttm.getInitialDelay();
602        this.ownToolTipDismissDelay = ttm.getDismissDelay();
603        this.ownToolTipReshowDelay = ttm.getReshowDelay();
604
605        this.zoomAroundAnchor = false;
606
607        this.overlays = new ArrayList<>();
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * Returns the chart contained in the panel.
612     *
613     * @return The chart (possibly {@code null}).
614     */
615    public JFreeChart getChart() {
616        return this.chart;
617    }
618
619    /**
620     * Sets the chart that is displayed in the panel.
621     *
622     * @param chart  the chart ({@code null} permitted).
623     */
624    public void setChart(JFreeChart chart) {
625
626        // stop listening for changes to the existing chart
627        if (this.chart != null) {
628            this.chart.removeChangeListener(this);
629            this.chart.removeProgressListener(this);
630        }
631
632        // add the new chart
633        this.chart = chart;
634        if (chart != null) {
635            this.chart.addChangeListener(this);
636            this.chart.addProgressListener(this);
637            Plot plot = chart.getPlot();
638            this.domainZoomable = false;
639            this.rangeZoomable = false;
640            if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
641                Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
642                this.domainZoomable = z.isDomainZoomable();
643                this.rangeZoomable = z.isRangeZoomable();
644                this.orientation = z.getOrientation();
645            }
646        }
647        else {
648            this.domainZoomable = false;
649            this.rangeZoomable = false;
650        }
651        if (this.useBuffer) {
652            this.refreshBuffer = true;
653        }
654        repaint();
655
656    }
657
658    /**
659     * Returns the minimum drawing width for charts.
660     * <P>
661     * If the width available on the panel is less than this, then the chart is
662     * drawn at the minimum width then scaled down to fit.
663     *
664     * @return The minimum drawing width.
665     */
666    public int getMinimumDrawWidth() {
667        return this.minimumDrawWidth;
668    }
669
670    /**
671     * Sets the minimum drawing width for the chart on this panel.
672     * <P>
673     * At the time the chart is drawn on the panel, if the available width is
674     * less than this amount, the chart will be drawn using the minimum width
675     * then scaled down to fit the available space.
676     *
677     * @param width  The width.
678     */
679    public void setMinimumDrawWidth(int width) {
680        this.minimumDrawWidth = width;
681    }

691    public int getMaximumDrawWidth() {
692        return this.maximumDrawWidth;

824    /**
825     * A convenience method that switches on mouse-based zooming.
826     *
827     * @param flag  {@code true} enables zooming and rectangle fill on
828     *              zoom.
829     */
830    public void setMouseZoomable(boolean flag) {
831        setMouseZoomable(flag, true);
832    }
833
834    /**
835     * A convenience method that switches on mouse-based zooming.
836     *
837     * @param flag  {@code true} if zooming enabled
838     * @param fillRectangle  {@code true} if zoom rectangle is filled,
839     *                       false if rectangle is shown as outline only.
840     */
841    public void setMouseZoomable(boolean flag, boolean fillRectangle) {
842        setDomainZoomable(flag);
843        setRangeZoomable(flag);
844        setFillZoomRectangle(fillRectangle);
845    }
846
847    /**
848     * Sets default modifier keys for pan operations for all mouse buttons.
849     * Modifiers for a specific button can be set with
850     * {@link #setPanModifiersEx(int, int)}.  If there are none set for
851     * a certain button, it will use the modifiers passed to this function,
852     * defaulting to {@link #getDefaultDragModifiersEx()} if this function
853     * was never called.
854     * <p>
855     * Only {@link InputEvent#SHIFT_DOWN_MASK}, {@link InputEvent#CTRL_DOWN_MASK},
856     * {@link InputEvent#META_DOWN_MASK} and {@link InputEvent#ALT_DOWN_MASK} are
857     * checked.  To avoid platform-specific problems, it is recommended to use
858     * {@link #getDefaultDragModifiersEx()} for one operation, and zero modifiers
859     * for the other.
860     * <p>
861     * If the same modifiers are set for both zooming and panning,
862     * panning will be performed.
863     *
864     * @param modifiersEx modifier keys, as returned by {@link InputEvent#getModifiersEx()}
865     */
866    public void setDefaultPanModifiersEx(int modifiersEx) {
867        this.panMask = modifiersEx;
868    }
869
870    /**
871     * Sets default modifier keys for zoom operations for all mouse buttons.
872     * Modifiers for a specific button can be set with
873     * {@link #setZoomModifiersEx(int, int)}.  If there are none set for
874     * a certain button, it will use the modifiers passed to this function,
875     * defaulting to zero (no modifiers) if this function was never called.
876     * <p>
877     * Only {@link InputEvent#SHIFT_DOWN_MASK}, {@link InputEvent#CTRL_DOWN_MASK},
878     * {@link InputEvent#META_DOWN_MASK} and {@link InputEvent#ALT_DOWN_MASK} are
879     * checked.  To avoid platform-specific problems, it is recommended to use
880     * {@link #getDefaultDragModifiersEx()} for one operation, and zero modifiers
881     * for the other.
882     * <p>
883     * If the same modifiers are set for both zooming and panning,
884     * panning will be performed.
885     *
886     * @param modifiersEx modifier keys, as returned by {@link InputEvent#getModifiersEx()}
887     */
888    public void setDefaultZoomModifiersEx(int modifiersEx) {
889        this.zoomMask = modifiersEx;
890    }
891
892    /**
893     * Sets modifier keys for panning with a specific mouse button. If there are
894     * none set for a certain button with this function, default modifiers set
895     * with {@link #setDefaultPanModifiersEx(int)} will be used, defaulting to
896     * {@link #getDefaultDragModifiersEx()} if none were set either.<p>
897     * Only {@link InputEvent#SHIFT_DOWN_MASK}, {@link InputEvent#CTRL_DOWN_MASK},
898     * {@link InputEvent#META_DOWN_MASK} and {@link InputEvent#ALT_DOWN_MASK} are
899     * checked.  To avoid platform-specific problems, it is recommended to use
900     * {@link #getDefaultDragModifiersEx()} for one operation, and zero modifiers
901     * for the other.
902     * <p>
903     * If the same modifiers are set for both zooming and panning,
904     * panning will be performed.
905     *
906     * @param mouseButton  the mouse button
907     * @param modifiersEx modifier keys, as returned by {@link InputEvent#getModifiersEx()}
908     */
909    public void setPanModifiersEx(int mouseButton, int modifiersEx) {
910        panButtonMasks.put(mouseButton, modifiersEx);
911    }
912
913    /**
914     * Sets modifier keys for zooming with a specific mouse button.
915     * If there are none set for a certain button with this function,
916     * default modifiers set with {@link #setDefaultZoomModifiersEx(int)}
917     * will be used, defaulting to zero (no modifiers)
918     * if none were set either.
919     * <p>
920     * Only {@link InputEvent#SHIFT_DOWN_MASK}, {@link InputEvent#CTRL_DOWN_MASK},
921     * {@link InputEvent#META_DOWN_MASK} and {@link InputEvent#ALT_DOWN_MASK} are
922     * checked.  To avoid platform-specific problems, it is recommended to use
923     * {@link #getDefaultDragModifiersEx()} for one operation, and zero modifiers
924     * for the other.
925     * <p>
926     * If the same modifiers are set for both zooming and panning,
927     * panning will be performed.
928     *
929     * @param mouseButton  the mouse button.
930     * @param modifiersEx modifier keys, as returned by {@link InputEvent#getModifiersEx()}
931     */
932    public void setZoomModifiersEx(int mouseButton, int modifiersEx) {
933        zoomButtonMasks.put(mouseButton, modifiersEx);
934    }

936    /**
937     * Returns the flag that determines whether or not zooming is enabled for
938     * the domain axis.
939     *
940     * @return A boolean.
941     */
942    public boolean isDomainZoomable() {
943        return this.domainZoomable;
944    }
945
946    /**
947     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not zooming is enabled for the
948     * domain axis.  A check is made to ensure that the current plot supports
949     * zooming for the domain values.
950     *
951     * @param flag  {@code true} enables zooming if possible.
952     */
953    public void setDomainZoomable(boolean flag) {
954        if (flag) {
955            Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
956            if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
957                Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
958                this.domainZoomable = z.isDomainZoomable();
959            }
960        }
961        else {
962            this.domainZoomable = false;
963        }
964    }
965
966    /**
967     * Returns the flag that determines whether or not zooming is enabled for
968     * the range axis.
969     *
970     * @return A boolean.
971     */
972    public boolean isRangeZoomable() {
973        return this.rangeZoomable;
974    }
975
976    /**
977     * A flag that controls mouse-based zooming on the vertical axis.
978     *
979     * @param flag  {@code true} enables zooming.
980     */
981    public void setRangeZoomable(boolean flag) {
982        if (flag) {
983            Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
984            if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
985                Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
986                this.rangeZoomable = z.isRangeZoomable();
987            }
988        }
989        else {
990            this.rangeZoomable = false;
991        }
992    }

1061    /**
1062     * Sets the default directory for the "save as" option.  If you set this
1063     * to {@code null}, the user's default directory will be used.
1064     *
1065     * @param directory  the directory ({@code null} permitted).
1066     */
1067    public void setDefaultDirectoryForSaveAs(File directory) {
1068        if (directory != null) {
1069            if (!directory.isDirectory()) {
1070                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1071                        "The 'directory' argument is not a directory.");
1072            }
1073        }
1074        this.defaultDirectoryForSaveAs = directory;
1075    }

1172    /**
1173     * The mouse wheel handler.
1174     */
1175    protected MouseWheelHandler mouseWheelHandler;
1176
1177    /**
1178     * Returns {@code true} if the mouse wheel handler is enabled, and
1179     * {@code false} otherwise.
1180     *
1181     * @return A boolean.
1182     */
1183    public boolean isMouseWheelEnabled() {
1184        return this.mouseWheelHandler != null;
1185    }
1186
1187    /**
1188     * Enables or disables mouse wheel support for the panel.
1189     *
1190     * @param flag  a boolean.
1191     */
1192    public void setMouseWheelEnabled(boolean flag) {
1193        if (flag && this.mouseWheelHandler == null) {
1194            this.mouseWheelHandler = new MouseWheelHandler(this);
1195        }
1196        else if (!flag && this.mouseWheelHandler != null) {
1197            this.removeMouseWheelListener(this.mouseWheelHandler);
1198            this.mouseWheelHandler = null;
1199        } 
1200    }
1201
1202    /**
1203     * Add an overlay to the panel.
1204     *
1205     * @param overlay  the overlay ({@code null} not permitted).
1206     */
1207    public void addOverlay(Overlay overlay) {
1208        Args.nullNotPermitted(overlay, "overlay");
1209        this.overlays.add(overlay);
1210        overlay.addChangeListener(this);
1211        repaint();
1212    }
1213
1214    /**
1215     * Removes an overlay from the panel.
1216     *
1217     * @param overlay  the overlay to remove ({@code null} not permitted).
1218     */
1219    public void removeOverlay(Overlay overlay) {
1220        Args.nullNotPermitted(overlay, "overlay");
1221        boolean removed = this.overlays.remove(overlay);
1222        if (removed) {
1223            overlay.removeChangeListener(this);
1224            repaint();
1225        }
1226    }
1227
1228    /**
1229     * Handles a change to an overlay by repainting the panel.
1230     *
1231     * @param event  the event.
1232     */
1233    @Override
1234    public void overlayChanged(OverlayChangeEvent event) {
1235        repaint();
1236    }
1237
1238    /**
1239     * Switches the display of tooltips for the panel on or off.  Note that
1240     * tooltips can only be displayed if the chart has been configured to
1241     * generate tooltip items.
1242     *
1243     * @param flag  {@code true} to enable tooltips, {@code false} to
1244     *              disable tooltips.
1245     */
1246    public void setDisplayToolTips(boolean flag) {
1247        if (flag) {
1248            ToolTipManager.sharedInstance().registerComponent(this);
1249        }
1250        else {
1251            ToolTipManager.sharedInstance().unregisterComponent(this);
1252        }
1253    }
1254
1255    /**
1256     * Returns a string for the tooltip.
1257     *
1258     * @param e  the mouse event.
1259     *
1260     * @return A tool tip or {@code null} if no tooltip is available.
1261     */
1262    @Override
1263    public String getToolTipText(MouseEvent e) {
1264        String result = null;
1265        if (this.info != null) {
1266            EntityCollection entities = this.info.getEntityCollection();
1267            if (entities != null) {
1268                Insets insets = getInsets();
1269                ChartEntity entity = entities.getEntity(
1270                        (int) ((e.getX() - insets.left) / this.scaleX),
1271                        (int) ((e.getY() - insets.top) / this.scaleY));
1272                if (entity != null) {
1273                    result = entity.getToolTipText();
1274                }
1275            }
1276        }
1277        return result;
1278    }
1279
1280    /**
1281     * Translates a Java2D point on the chart to a screen location.
1282     *
1283     * @param java2DPoint  the Java2D point.
1284     *
1285     * @return The screen location.
1286     */
1287    public Point translateJava2DToScreen(Point2D java2DPoint) {
1288        Insets insets = getInsets();
1289        int x = (int) (java2DPoint.getX() * this.scaleX + insets.left);
1290        int y = (int) (java2DPoint.getY() * this.scaleY + insets.top);
1291        return new Point(x, y);
1292    }
1293
1294    /**
1295     * Translates a panel (component) location to a Java2D point.
1296     *
1297     * @param screenPoint  the screen location ({@code null} not
1298     *                     permitted).
1299     *
1300     * @return The Java2D coordinates.
1301     */
1302    public Point2D translateScreenToJava2D(Point screenPoint) {
1303        Insets insets = getInsets();
1304        double x = (screenPoint.getX() - insets.left) / this.scaleX;
1305        double y = (screenPoint.getY() - insets.top) / this.scaleY;
1306        return new Point2D.Double(x, y);
1307    }
1308
1309    /**
1310     * Applies any scaling that is in effect for the chart drawing to the
1311     * given rectangle.
1312     *
1313     * @param rect  the rectangle ({@code null} not permitted).
1314     *
1315     * @return A new scaled rectangle.
1316     */
1317    public Rectangle2D scale(Rectangle2D rect) {
1318        Insets insets = getInsets();
1319        double x = rect.getX() * getScaleX() + insets.left;
1320        double y = rect.getY() * getScaleY() + insets.top;
1321        double w = rect.getWidth() * getScaleX();
1322        double h = rect.getHeight() * getScaleY();
1323        return new Rectangle2D.Double(x, y, w, h);
1324    }
1325
1326    /**
1327     * Returns the chart entity at a given point.
1328     * <P>
1329     * This method will return null if there is (a) no entity at the given
1330     * point, or (b) no entity collection has been generated.
1331     *
1332     * @param viewX  the x-coordinate.
1333     * @param viewY  the y-coordinate.
1334     *
1335     * @return The chart entity (possibly {@code null}).
1336     */
1337    public ChartEntity getEntityForPoint(int viewX, int viewY) {
1338
1339        ChartEntity result = null;
1340        if (this.info != null) {
1341            Insets insets = getInsets();
1342            double x = (viewX - insets.left) / this.scaleX;
1343            double y = (viewY - insets.top) / this.scaleY;
1344            EntityCollection entities = this.info.getEntityCollection();
1345            result = entities != null ? entities.getEntity(x, y) : null;
1346        }
1347        return result;
1348
1349    }
1350
1351    /**
1352     * Returns the flag that controls whether or not the offscreen buffer
1353     * needs to be refreshed.
1354     *
1355     * @return A boolean.
1356     */
1357    public boolean getRefreshBuffer() {
1358        return this.refreshBuffer;
1359    }
1360
1361    /**
1362     * Sets the refresh buffer flag.  This flag is used to avoid unnecessary
1363     * redrawing of the chart when the offscreen image buffer is used.
1364     *
1365     * @param flag  {@code true} indicates that the buffer should be
1366     *              refreshed.
1367     */
1368    public void setRefreshBuffer(boolean flag) {
1369        this.refreshBuffer = flag;
1370    }
1371
1372    /**
1373     * Paints the component by drawing the chart to fill the entire component,
1374     * but allowing for the insets (which will be non-zero if a border has been
1375     * set for this component).  To increase performance (at the expense of
1376     * memory), an off-screen buffer image can be used.
1377     *
1378     * @param g  the graphics device for drawing on.
1379     */
1380    @Override
1381    public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {
1382        super.paintComponent(g);
1383        if (this.chart == null) {
1384            return;
1385        }
1386        Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) g.create();
1387        
1388        // first determine the size of the chart rendering area...
1389        Dimension size = getSize();
1390        Insets insets = getInsets();
1391        Rectangle2D available = new Rectangle2D.Double(insets.left, insets.top,
1392                size.getWidth() - insets.left - insets.right,
1393                size.getHeight() - insets.top - insets.bottom);
1394
1395        // work out if scaling is required...
1396        boolean scale = false;
1397        double drawWidth = available.getWidth();
1398        double drawHeight = available.getHeight();
1399        this.scaleX = 1.0;
1400        this.scaleY = 1.0;
1401
1402        if (drawWidth < this.minimumDrawWidth) {
1403            this.scaleX = drawWidth / this.minimumDrawWidth;
1404            drawWidth = this.minimumDrawWidth;
1405            scale = true;
1406        }
1407        else if (drawWidth > this.maximumDrawWidth) {
1408            this.scaleX = drawWidth / this.maximumDrawWidth;
1409            drawWidth = this.maximumDrawWidth;
1410            scale = true;
1411        }
1412
1413        if (drawHeight < this.minimumDrawHeight) {
1414            this.scaleY = drawHeight / this.minimumDrawHeight;
1415            drawHeight = this.minimumDrawHeight;
1416            scale = true;
1417        }
1418        else if (drawHeight > this.maximumDrawHeight) {
1419            this.scaleY = drawHeight / this.maximumDrawHeight;
1420            drawHeight = this.maximumDrawHeight;
1421            scale = true;
1422        }
1423
1424        Rectangle2D chartArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(0.0, 0.0, drawWidth,
1425                drawHeight);
1426
1427        // are we using the chart buffer?
1428        if (this.useBuffer) {
1429
1430            // for better rendering on the HiDPI monitors upscaling the buffer to the "native" resoution
1431            // instead of using logical one provided by Swing
1432            final AffineTransform globalTransform = ((Graphics2D) g).getTransform();
1433            final double globalScaleX = globalTransform.getScaleX();
1434            final double globalScaleY = globalTransform.getScaleY();
1435
1436            final int scaledWidth = (int) (available.getWidth() * globalScaleX);
1437            final int scaledHeight = (int) (available.getHeight() * globalScaleY);
1438
1439            // do we need to resize the buffer?
1440            if ((this.chartBuffer == null)
1441                    || (this.chartBufferWidth != scaledWidth)
1442                    || (this.chartBufferHeight != scaledHeight)) {
1443                this.chartBufferWidth = scaledWidth;
1444                this.chartBufferHeight = scaledHeight;
1445                GraphicsConfiguration gc = g2.getDeviceConfiguration();
1446                this.chartBuffer = gc.createCompatibleImage(
1447                        this.chartBufferWidth, this.chartBufferHeight,
1448                        Transparency.TRANSLUCENT);
1449                this.refreshBuffer = true;
1450            }
1451
1452            // do we need to redraw the buffer?
1453            if (this.refreshBuffer) {
1454
1455                this.refreshBuffer = false; // clear the flag
1456
1457                // scale graphics of the buffer to the same value as global
1458                // Swing graphics - this allow to paint all elements as usual
1459                // but applies all necessary smoothing
1460                Graphics2D bufferG2 = (Graphics2D) this.chartBuffer.getGraphics();
1461                bufferG2.scale(globalScaleX, globalScaleY);
1462
1463                Rectangle2D bufferArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(
1464                        0, 0, available.getWidth(), available.getHeight());
1465
1466                // make the background of the buffer clear and transparent
1467                Composite savedComposite = bufferG2.getComposite();
1468                bufferG2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.CLEAR, 0.0f));
1469                Rectangle r = new Rectangle(0, 0, (int) available.getWidth(), (int) available.getHeight());
1470                bufferG2.fill(r);
1471                bufferG2.setComposite(savedComposite);
1472                
1473                if (scale) {
1474                    AffineTransform saved = bufferG2.getTransform();
1475                    AffineTransform st = AffineTransform.getScaleInstance(
1476                            this.scaleX, this.scaleY);
1477                    bufferG2.transform(st);
1478                    this.chart.draw(bufferG2, chartArea, this.anchor,
1479                            this.info);
1480                    bufferG2.setTransform(saved);
1481                } else {
1482                    this.chart.draw(bufferG2, bufferArea, this.anchor,
1483                            this.info);
1484                }
1485                bufferG2.dispose();
1486            }
1487
1488            // zap the buffer onto the panel...
1489            g2.drawImage(this.chartBuffer, insets.left, insets.top, (int) available.getWidth(), (int) available.getHeight(), this);
1490            g2.addRenderingHints(this.chart.getRenderingHints()); // bug#187
1491
1492        } else { // redrawing the chart every time...
1493            AffineTransform saved = g2.getTransform();
1494            g2.translate(insets.left, insets.top);
1495            if (scale) {
1496                AffineTransform st = AffineTransform.getScaleInstance(
1497                        this.scaleX, this.scaleY);
1498                g2.transform(st);
1499            }
1500            this.chart.draw(g2, chartArea, this.anchor, this.info);
1501            g2.setTransform(saved);
1502
1503        }
1504
1505        for (Overlay overlay : this.overlays) {
1506            overlay.paintOverlay(g2, this);
1507        }
1508
1509        // redraw the zoom rectangle (if present) - if useBuffer is false,
1510        // we use XOR so we can XOR the rectangle away again without redrawing
1511        // the chart
1512        selectionZoomStrategy.drawZoomRectangle(g2, !this.useBuffer);
1513
1514        g2.dispose();
1515
1516        this.anchor = null;
1517    }
1518
1519    /**
1520     * Receives notification of changes to the chart, and redraws the chart.
1521     *
1522     * @param event  details of the chart change event.
1523     */
1524    @Override
1525    public void chartChanged(ChartChangeEvent event) {
1526        this.refreshBuffer = true;
1527        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
1528        if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
1529            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
1530            this.orientation = z.getOrientation();
1531        }
1532        repaint();
1533    }
1534
1535    /**
1536     * Receives notification of a chart progress event.
1537     *
1538     * @param event  the event.
1539     */
1540    @Override
1541    public void chartProgress(ChartProgressEvent event) {
1542        // does nothing - override if necessary
1543    }
1544
1545    /**
1546     * Handles action events generated by the popup menu.
1547     *
1548     * @param event  the event.
1549     */
1550    @Override
1551    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event) {
1552
1553        String command = event.getActionCommand();
1554
1555        // many of the zoom methods need a screen location - all we have is
1556        // the zoomPoint, but it might be null.  Here we grab the x and y
1557        // coordinates, or use defaults...
1558        double screenX = -1.0;
1559        double screenY = -1.0;
1560        Point2D zoomPoint = this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomPoint();
1561        if (zoomPoint != null) {
1562            screenX = zoomPoint.getX();
1563            screenY = zoomPoint.getY();
1564        }
1565
1566        switch (command) {
1567        case PROPERTIES_COMMAND:
1568            doEditChartProperties();
1569            break;
1570        case COPY_COMMAND:
1571            doCopy();
1572            break;
1573        case SAVE_AS_PNG_COMMAND:
1574            try {
1575                doSaveAs();
1576            } catch (IOException e) {
1577                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "I/O error occurred.",
1578                        localizationResources.getString("Save_as_PNG"), JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
1579            }
1580            break;
1581        case SAVE_AS_PNG_SIZE_COMMAND:
1582            try {
1583                final Dimension ss = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize();
1584                doSaveAs(ss.width, ss.height);
1585            } catch (IOException e) {
1586                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(ChartPanel.this, "I/O error occurred.",
1587                        localizationResources.getString("Save_as_PNG"), JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
1588            }
1589            break;
1590        case SAVE_AS_SVG_COMMAND:
1591            try {
1592                saveAsSVG(null);
1593            } catch (IOException e) {
1594                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "I/O error occurred.",
1595                        localizationResources.getString("Save_as_SVG"), JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
1596            }
1597            break;
1598        case SAVE_AS_PDF_COMMAND:
1599            saveAsPDF(null);
1600            break;
1601        case PRINT_COMMAND:
1602            createChartPrintJob();
1603            break;
1604        case ZOOM_IN_BOTH_COMMAND:
1605            zoomInBoth(screenX, screenY);
1606            break;
1607        case ZOOM_IN_DOMAIN_COMMAND:
1608            zoomInDomain(screenX, screenY);
1609            break;
1610        case ZOOM_IN_RANGE_COMMAND:
1611            zoomInRange(screenX, screenY);
1612            break;
1613        case ZOOM_OUT_BOTH_COMMAND:
1614            zoomOutBoth(screenX, screenY);
1615            break;
1616        case ZOOM_OUT_DOMAIN_COMMAND:
1617            zoomOutDomain(screenX, screenY);
1618            break;
1619        case ZOOM_OUT_RANGE_COMMAND:
1620            zoomOutRange(screenX, screenY);
1621            break;
1622        case ZOOM_RESET_BOTH_COMMAND:
1623            restoreAutoBounds();
1624            break;
1625        case ZOOM_RESET_DOMAIN_COMMAND:
1626            restoreAutoDomainBounds();
1627            break;
1628        case ZOOM_RESET_RANGE_COMMAND:
1629            restoreAutoRangeBounds();
1630            break;
1631        }
1632    }
1633
1634    /**
1635     * Handles a 'mouse entered' event. This method changes the tooltip delays
1636     * of ToolTipManager.sharedInstance() to the possibly different values set
1637     * for this chart panel.
1638     *
1639     * @param e  the mouse event.
1640     */
1641    @Override
1642    public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e) {
1643        if (!this.ownToolTipDelaysActive) {
1644            ToolTipManager ttm = ToolTipManager.sharedInstance();
1645
1646            this.originalToolTipInitialDelay = ttm.getInitialDelay();
1647            ttm.setInitialDelay(this.ownToolTipInitialDelay);
1648
1649            this.originalToolTipReshowDelay = ttm.getReshowDelay();
1650            ttm.setReshowDelay(this.ownToolTipReshowDelay);
1651
1652            this.originalToolTipDismissDelay = ttm.getDismissDelay();
1653            ttm.setDismissDelay(this.ownToolTipDismissDelay);
1654
1655            this.ownToolTipDelaysActive = true;
1656        }
1657    }
1658
1659    /**
1660     * Handles a 'mouse exited' event. This method resets the tooltip delays of
1661     * ToolTipManager.sharedInstance() to their
1662     * original values in effect before mouseEntered()
1663     *
1664     * @param e  the mouse event.
1665     */
1666    @Override
1667    public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e) {
1668        if (this.ownToolTipDelaysActive) {
1669            // restore original tooltip dealys
1670            ToolTipManager ttm = ToolTipManager.sharedInstance();
1671            ttm.setInitialDelay(this.originalToolTipInitialDelay);
1672            ttm.setReshowDelay(this.originalToolTipReshowDelay);
1673            ttm.setDismissDelay(this.originalToolTipDismissDelay);
1674            this.ownToolTipDelaysActive = false;
1675        }
1676    }
1677
1678    /**
1679     * Handles a 'mouse pressed' event.
1680     * <P>
1681     * This event is the popup trigger on Unix/Linux.  For Windows, the popup
1682     * trigger is the 'mouse released' event.
1683     *
1684     * @param e  The mouse event.
1685     */
1686    @Override
1687    public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {
1688        if (this.chart == null) {
1689            return;
1690        }
1691        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
1692        int button = e.getButton();
1693        int mods = e.getModifiersEx();
1694        if ((mods & MODIFIERS_EX_MASK) == panButtonMasks.getOrDefault(button, panMask)) {
1695            // can we pan this plot?
1696            if (plot instanceof Pannable) {
1697                Pannable pannable = (Pannable) plot;
1698                if (pannable.isDomainPannable() || pannable.isRangePannable()) {
1699                    Rectangle2D screenDataArea = getScreenDataArea(e.getX(),
1700                            e.getY());
1701                    if (screenDataArea != null && screenDataArea.contains(
1702                            e.getPoint())) {
1703                        this.panW = screenDataArea.getWidth();
1704                        this.panH = screenDataArea.getHeight();
1705                        this.panLast = e.getPoint();
1706                        setCursor(Cursor.getPredefinedCursor(
1707                                Cursor.MOVE_CURSOR));
1708                    }
1709                }
1710                // the actual panning occurs later in the mouseDragged() 
1711                // method
1712            }
1713        }
1714        else if (!this.selectionZoomStrategy.isActivated()) {
1715            if ((mods & MODIFIERS_EX_MASK) == zoomButtonMasks.getOrDefault(button, zoomMask)) {
1716                Rectangle2D screenDataArea = getScreenDataArea(e.getX(), e.getY());
1717                if (screenDataArea != null) {
1718                Point2D zoomPoint = getPointInRectangle(e.getX(), e.getY(),
1719                            screenDataArea);
1720                selectionZoomStrategy.setZoomPoint(zoomPoint);
1721                }
1722                else {
1723                selectionZoomStrategy.setZoomPoint(null);
1724                }
1725            }
1726            if (e.isPopupTrigger()) {
1727                if (this.popup != null) {
1728                    chartPanelProduct.displayPopupMenu(e.getX(), e.getY(), this.popup, this.chart, this);
1729                }
1730            }
1731        }
1732    }
1733
1734    /**
1735     * Returns a point based on (x, y) but constrained to be within the bounds
1736     * of the given rectangle.  This method could be moved to JCommon.
1737     *
1738     * @param x  the x-coordinate.
1739     * @param y  the y-coordinate.
1740     * @param area  the rectangle ({@code null} not permitted).
1741     *
1742     * @return A point within the rectangle.
1743     */
1744    protected Point2D getPointInRectangle(int x, int y, Rectangle2D area) {
1745        double xx = Math.max(area.getMinX(), Math.min(x, area.getMaxX()));
1746        double yy = Math.max(area.getMinY(), Math.min(y, area.getMaxY()));
1747        return new Point2D.Double(xx, yy);
1748    }
1749
1750    /**
1751     * Handles a 'mouse dragged' event.
1752     *
1753     * @param e  the mouse event.
1754     */
1755    @Override
1756    public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e) {
1757
1758        // if the popup menu has already been triggered, then ignore dragging...
1759        if (this.popup != null && this.popup.isShowing()) {
1760            return;
1761        }
1762
1763        // handle panning if we have a start point
1764        if (this.panLast != null) {
1765            double dx = e.getX() - this.panLast.getX();
1766            double dy = e.getY() - this.panLast.getY();
1767            if (dx == 0.0 && dy == 0.0) {
1768                return;
1769            }
1770            double wPercent = -dx / this.panW;
1771            double hPercent = dy / this.panH;
1772            boolean old = this.chart.getPlot().isNotify();
1773            this.chart.getPlot().setNotify(false);
1774            Pannable p = (Pannable) this.chart.getPlot();
1775            if (p.getOrientation() == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
1776                p.panDomainAxes(wPercent, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
1777                        this.panLast);
1778                p.panRangeAxes(hPercent, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
1779                        this.panLast);
1780            }
1781            else {
1782                p.panDomainAxes(hPercent, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
1783                        this.panLast);
1784                p.panRangeAxes(wPercent, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
1785                        this.panLast);
1786            }
1787            this.panLast = e.getPoint();
1788            this.chart.getPlot().setNotify(old);
1789            return;
1790        }
1791
1792        // if no initial zoom point was set, ignore dragging...
1793        if (this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomPoint() == null) {
1794            return;
1795        }
1796        Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) getGraphics();
1797
1798        // erase the previous zoom rectangle (if any).  We only need to do
1799        // this is we are using XOR mode, which we do when we're not using
1800        // the buffer (if there is a buffer, then at the end of this method we
1801        // just trigger a repaint)
1802        if (!this.useBuffer) {
1803            selectionZoomStrategy.drawZoomRectangle(g2, true);
1804        }
1805
1806        boolean hZoom, vZoom;
1807        if (this.orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1808            hZoom = this.rangeZoomable;
1809            vZoom = this.domainZoomable;
1810        }
1811        else {
1812            hZoom = this.domainZoomable;
1813            vZoom = this.rangeZoomable;
1814        }
1815        Point2D zoomPoint = this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomPoint();
1816        Rectangle2D scaledDataArea = getScreenDataArea(
1817                (int) zoomPoint.getX(), (int) zoomPoint.getY());
1818
1819        selectionZoomStrategy.updateZoomRectangleSelection(e, hZoom, vZoom, scaledDataArea);
1820
1821        // Draw the new zoom rectangle...
1822        if (this.useBuffer) {
1823            repaint();
1824        }
1825        else {
1826            // with no buffer, we use XOR to draw the rectangle "over" the
1827            // chart...
1828            selectionZoomStrategy.drawZoomRectangle(g2, true);
1829        }
1830        g2.dispose();
1831
1832    }
1833
1834    /**
1835     * Handles a 'mouse released' event.  On Windows, we need to check if this
1836     * is a popup trigger, but only if we haven't already been tracking a zoom
1837     * rectangle.
1838     *
1839     * @param e  information about the event.
1840     */
1841    @Override
1842    public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {
1843
1844        // if we've been panning, we need to reset now that the mouse is 
1845        // released...
1846        if (this.panLast != null) {
1847            this.panLast = null;
1848            setCursor(Cursor.getDefaultCursor());
1849        }
1850
1851        else if (this.selectionZoomStrategy.isActivated()) {
1852            boolean hZoom, vZoom;
1853            if (this.orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
1854                hZoom = this.rangeZoomable;
1855                vZoom = this.domainZoomable;
1856            }
1857            else {
1858                hZoom = this.domainZoomable;
1859                vZoom = this.rangeZoomable;
1860            }
1861
1862            Point2D zoomPoint = this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomPoint();
1863            boolean zoomTrigger1 = hZoom && Math.abs(e.getX()
1864                - zoomPoint.getX()) >= this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomTriggerDistance();
1865            boolean zoomTrigger2 = vZoom && Math.abs(e.getY()
1866                - zoomPoint.getY()) >= this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomTriggerDistance();
1867            if (zoomTrigger1 || zoomTrigger2) {
1868                if ((hZoom && (e.getX() < zoomPoint.getX()))
1869                    || (vZoom && (e.getY() < zoomPoint.getY()))) {
1870                    restoreAutoBounds();
1871                }
1872                else {
1873                    Rectangle2D screenDataArea = getScreenDataArea(
1874                            (int) zoomPoint.getX(),
1875                            (int) zoomPoint.getY());
1876
1877                    Rectangle2D zoomArea = selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomRectangle(hZoom, vZoom, screenDataArea);
1878                    zoom(zoomArea);
1879                }
1880                this.selectionZoomStrategy.reset();
1881            }
1882            else {
1883                // erase the zoom rectangle
1884                Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) getGraphics();
1885                if (this.useBuffer) {
1886                    repaint();
1887                }
1888                else {
1889                    selectionZoomStrategy.drawZoomRectangle(g2, true);
1890                }
1891                g2.dispose();
1892                this.selectionZoomStrategy.reset();
1893            }
1894
1895        }
1896
1897        else if (e.isPopupTrigger()) {
1898            if (this.popup != null) {
1899                chartPanelProduct.displayPopupMenu(e.getX(), e.getY(), this.popup, this.chart, this);
1900            }
1901        }
1902
1903    }
1904
1905    /**
1906     * Receives notification of mouse clicks on the panel. These are
1907     * translated and passed on to any registered {@link ChartMouseListener}s.
1908     *
1909     * @param event  Information about the mouse event.
1910     */
1911    @Override
1912    public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent event) {
1913
1914        Insets insets = getInsets();
1915        int x = (int) ((event.getX() - insets.left) / this.scaleX);
1916        int y = (int) ((event.getY() - insets.top) / this.scaleY);
1917
1918        this.anchor = new Point2D.Double(x, y);
1919        if (this.chart == null) {
1920            return;
1921        }
1922        this.chart.setNotify(true);  // force a redraw
1923        // new entity code...
1924        Object[] listeners = this.chartMouseListeners.getListeners(
1925                ChartMouseListener.class);
1926        if (listeners.length == 0) {
1927            return;
1928        }
1929
1930        ChartEntity entity = null;
1931        if (this.info != null) {
1932            EntityCollection entities = this.info.getEntityCollection();
1933            if (entities != null) {
1934                entity = entities.getEntity(x, y);
1935            }
1936        }
1937        ChartMouseEvent chartEvent = new ChartMouseEvent(getChart(), event,
1938                entity);
1939        for (int i = listeners.length - 1; i >= 0; i -= 1) {
1940            ((ChartMouseListener) listeners[i]).chartMouseClicked(chartEvent);
1941        }
1942
1943    }
1944
1945    /**
1946     * Implementation of the MouseMotionListener's method.
1947     *
1948     * @param e  the event.
1949     */
1950    @Override
1951    public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e) {
1952        Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) getGraphics();
1953        g2.dispose();
1954
1955        Object[] listeners = this.chartMouseListeners.getListeners(
1956                ChartMouseListener.class);
1957        if (listeners.length == 0) {
1958            return;
1959        }
1960        Insets insets = getInsets();
1961        int x = (int) ((e.getX() - insets.left) / this.scaleX);
1962        int y = (int) ((e.getY() - insets.top) / this.scaleY);
1963
1964        ChartEntity entity = null;
1965        if (this.info != null) {
1966            EntityCollection entities = this.info.getEntityCollection();
1967            if (entities != null) {
1968                entity = entities.getEntity(x, y);
1969            }
1970        }
1971
1972        // we can only generate events if the panel's chart is not null
1973        // (see bug report 1556951)
1974        if (this.chart != null) {
1975            ChartMouseEvent event = new ChartMouseEvent(getChart(), e, entity);
1976            for (int i = listeners.length - 1; i >= 0; i -= 1) {
1977                ((ChartMouseListener) listeners[i]).chartMouseMoved(event);
1978            }
1979        }
1980
1981    }
1982
1983    /**
1984     * Zooms in on an anchor point (specified in screen coordinate space).
1985     *
1986     * @param x  the x value (in screen coordinates).
1987     * @param y  the y value (in screen coordinates).
1988     */
1989    public void zoomInBoth(double x, double y) {
1990        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
1991        if (plot == null) {
1992            return;
1993        }
1994        // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
1995        // one notification happens even though we update multiple
1996        // axes...
1997        boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
1998        plot.setNotify(false);
1999        zoomInDomain(x, y);
2000        zoomInRange(x, y);
2001        plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2002    }
2003
2004    /**
2005     * Decreases the length of the domain axis, centered about the given
2006     * coordinate on the screen.  The length of the domain axis is reduced
2007     * by the value of {@link #getZoomInFactor()}.
2008     *
2009     * @param x  the x coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2010     * @param y  the y-coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2011     */
2012    public void zoomInDomain(double x, double y) {
2013        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2014        if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
2015            // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2016            // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2017            // axes...
2018            boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2019            plot.setNotify(false);
2020            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
2021            z.zoomDomainAxes(this.zoomInFactor, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
2022                    translateScreenToJava2D(new Point((int) x, (int) y)),
2023                    this.zoomAroundAnchor);
2024            plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2025        }
2026    }
2027
2028    /**
2029     * Decreases the length of the range axis, centered about the given
2030     * coordinate on the screen.  The length of the range axis is reduced by
2031     * the value of {@link #getZoomInFactor()}.
2032     *
2033     * @param x  the x-coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2034     * @param y  the y coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2035     */
2036    public void zoomInRange(double x, double y) {
2037        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2038        if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
2039            // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2040            // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2041            // axes...
2042            boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2043            plot.setNotify(false);
2044            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
2045            z.zoomRangeAxes(this.zoomInFactor, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
2046                    translateScreenToJava2D(new Point((int) x, (int) y)),
2047                    this.zoomAroundAnchor);
2048            plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2049        }
2050    }
2051
2052    /**
2053     * Zooms out on an anchor point (specified in screen coordinate space).
2054     *
2055     * @param x  the x value (in screen coordinates).
2056     * @param y  the y value (in screen coordinates).
2057     */
2058    public void zoomOutBoth(double x, double y) {
2059        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2060        if (plot == null) {
2061            return;
2062        }
2063        // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2064        // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2065        // axes...
2066        boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2067        plot.setNotify(false);
2068        zoomOutDomain(x, y);
2069        zoomOutRange(x, y);
2070        plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2071    }
2072
2073    /**
2074     * Increases the length of the domain axis, centered about the given
2075     * coordinate on the screen.  The length of the domain axis is increased
2076     * by the value of {@link #getZoomOutFactor()}.
2077     *
2078     * @param x  the x coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2079     * @param y  the y-coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2080     */
2081    public void zoomOutDomain(double x, double y) {

2084            // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2085            // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2086            // axes...
2087            boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2088            plot.setNotify(false);
2089            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
2090            z.zoomDomainAxes(this.zoomOutFactor, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
2091                    translateScreenToJava2D(new Point((int) x, (int) y)),
2092                    this.zoomAroundAnchor);
2093            plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2094        }
2095    }
2096
2097    /**
2098     * Increases the length the range axis, centered about the given
2099     * coordinate on the screen.  The length of the range axis is increased
2100     * by the value of {@link #getZoomOutFactor()}.
2101     *
2102     * @param x  the x coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2103     * @param y  the y-coordinate (in screen coordinates).
2104     */
2105    public void zoomOutRange(double x, double y) {
2106        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2107        if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
2108            // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2109            // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2110            // axes...
2111            boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2112            plot.setNotify(false);
2113            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
2114            z.zoomRangeAxes(this.zoomOutFactor, this.info.getPlotInfo(),
2115                    translateScreenToJava2D(new Point((int) x, (int) y)),
2116                    this.zoomAroundAnchor);
2117            plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2118        }
2119    }
2120
2121    /**
2122     * Zooms in on a selected region.
2123     *
2124     * @param selection  the selected region.
2125     */
2126    public void zoom(Rectangle2D selection) {
2127
2128        // get the origin of the zoom selection in the Java2D space used for
2129        // drawing the chart (that is, before any scaling to fit the panel)
2130        Point2D selectOrigin = translateScreenToJava2D(new Point(
2131                (int) Math.ceil(selection.getX()),
2132                (int) Math.ceil(selection.getY())));
2133        PlotRenderingInfo plotInfo = this.info.getPlotInfo();
2134        Rectangle2D scaledDataArea = getScreenDataArea(
2135                (int) selection.getCenterX(), (int) selection.getCenterY());
2136        if ((selection.getHeight() > 0) && (selection.getWidth() > 0)) {
2137
2138            double hLower = (selection.getMinX() - scaledDataArea.getMinX())
2139                / scaledDataArea.getWidth();
2140            double hUpper = (selection.getMaxX() - scaledDataArea.getMinX())
2141                / scaledDataArea.getWidth();
2142            double vLower = (scaledDataArea.getMaxY() - selection.getMaxY())
2143                / scaledDataArea.getHeight();
2144            double vUpper = (scaledDataArea.getMaxY() - selection.getMinY())
2145                / scaledDataArea.getHeight();
2146
2147            Plot p = this.chart.getPlot();
2148            if (p instanceof Zoomable) {
2149                // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2150                // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2151                // axes...
2152                boolean savedNotify = p.isNotify();
2153                p.setNotify(false);
2154                Zoomable z = (Zoomable) p;
2155                if (z.getOrientation() == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
2156                    z.zoomDomainAxes(vLower, vUpper, plotInfo, selectOrigin);
2157                    z.zoomRangeAxes(hLower, hUpper, plotInfo, selectOrigin);
2158                }
2159                else {
2160                    z.zoomDomainAxes(hLower, hUpper, plotInfo, selectOrigin);
2161                    z.zoomRangeAxes(vLower, vUpper, plotInfo, selectOrigin);
2162                }
2163                p.setNotify(savedNotify);
2164            }
2165
2166        }
2167
2168    }
2169
2170    /**
2171     * Restores the auto-range calculation on both axes.
2172     */
2173    public void restoreAutoBounds() {
2174        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2175        if (plot == null) {
2176            return;
2177        }
2178        // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2179        // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2180        // axes...
2181        boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2182        plot.setNotify(false);
2183        restoreAutoDomainBounds();
2184        restoreAutoRangeBounds();
2185        plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2186    }
2187
2188    /**
2189     * Restores the auto-range calculation on the domain axis.
2190     */
2191    public void restoreAutoDomainBounds() {
2192        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2193        if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
2194            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
2195            // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2196            // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2197            // axes...
2198            boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2199            plot.setNotify(false);
2200            // we need to guard against this.zoomPoint being null
2201            Point2D zoomPoint = this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomPoint();
2202            Point2D zp = zoomPoint != null ? zoomPoint : new Point();
2203            z.zoomDomainAxes(0.0, this.info.getPlotInfo(), zp);
2204            plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2205        }
2206    }
2207
2208    /**
2209     * Restores the auto-range calculation on the range axis.
2210     */
2211    public void restoreAutoRangeBounds() {
2212        Plot plot = this.chart.getPlot();
2213        if (plot instanceof Zoomable) {
2214            Zoomable z = (Zoomable) plot;
2215            // here we tweak the notify flag on the plot so that only
2216            // one notification happens even though we update multiple
2217            // axes...
2218            boolean savedNotify = plot.isNotify();
2219            plot.setNotify(false);
2220            // we need to guard against this.zoomPoint being null
2221            Point2D zoomPoint = this.selectionZoomStrategy.getZoomPoint();
2222            Point2D zp = zoomPoint != null ? zoomPoint : new Point();
2223            z.zoomRangeAxes(0.0, this.info.getPlotInfo(), zp);
2224            plot.setNotify(savedNotify);
2225        }
2226    }
2227
2228    /**
2229     * Returns the data area for the chart (the area inside the axes) with the
2230     * current scaling applied (that is, the area as it appears on screen).
2231     *
2232     * @return The scaled data area.
2233     */
2234    public Rectangle2D getScreenDataArea() {
2235        Rectangle2D dataArea = this.info.getPlotInfo().getDataArea();
2236        Insets insets = getInsets();
2237        double x = dataArea.getX() * this.scaleX + insets.left;
2238        double y = dataArea.getY() * this.scaleY + insets.top;
2239        double w = dataArea.getWidth() * this.scaleX;
2240        double h = dataArea.getHeight() * this.scaleY;
2241        return new Rectangle2D.Double(x, y, w, h);
2242    }
2243
2244    /**
2245     * Returns the data area (the area inside the axes) for the plot or subplot,
2246     * with the current scaling applied.
2247     *
2248     * @param x  the x-coordinate (for subplot selection).
2249     * @param y  the y-coordinate (for subplot selection).
2250     *
2251     * @return The scaled data area.
2252     */
2253    public Rectangle2D getScreenDataArea(int x, int y) {
2254        PlotRenderingInfo plotInfo = this.info.getPlotInfo();
2255        Rectangle2D result;
2256        if (plotInfo.getSubplotCount() == 0) {
2257            result = getScreenDataArea();
2258        }
2259        else {
2260            // get the origin of the zoom selection in the Java2D space used for
2261            // drawing the chart (that is, before any scaling to fit the panel)
2262            Point2D selectOrigin = translateScreenToJava2D(new Point(x, y));
2263            int subplotIndex = plotInfo.getSubplotIndex(selectOrigin);
2264            if (subplotIndex == -1) {
2265                return null;
2266            }
2267            result = scale(plotInfo.getSubplotInfo(subplotIndex).getDataArea());
2268        }
2269        return result;
2270    }

2387    /**
2388     * Displays a dialog that allows the user to edit the properties for the
2389     * current chart.
2390     */
2391    public void doEditChartProperties() {
2392
2393        ChartEditorFactory factory = new DefaultChartEditorFactory();
2394//        ChartEditor editor = ChartEditorManager.getChartEditor(this.chart);
2395        ChartEditor editor = factory.createEditor(chart);
2396        int result = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this, editor,
2397                localizationResources.getString("Chart_Properties"),
2398                JOptionPane.OK_CANCEL_OPTION, JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE);
2399        if (result == JOptionPane.OK_OPTION) {
2400            editor.updateChart(this.chart);
2401        }
2402
2403    }
