2405    /**
2406     * Copies the current chart to the system clipboard.
2407     */
2408    public void doCopy() {
2409        Clipboard systemClipboard
2410                = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getSystemClipboard();
2411        Insets insets = getInsets();
2412        int w = getWidth() - insets.left - insets.right;
2413        int h = getHeight() - insets.top - insets.bottom;
2414        ChartTransferable selection = new ChartTransferable(this.chart, w, h,
2415                getMinimumDrawWidth(), getMinimumDrawHeight(),
2416                getMaximumDrawWidth(), getMaximumDrawHeight(), true);
2417        systemClipboard.setContents(selection, null);
2418    }
2419
2420    /**
2421     * Opens a file chooser and gives the user an opportunity to save the chart
2422     * in PNG format.
2423     *
2424     * @throws IOException if there is an I/O error.
2425     */
2426    public void doSaveAs() throws IOException {
2427        doSaveAs(-1, -1);
2428    }
2429
2430    /**
2431     * Opens a file chooser and gives the user an opportunity to save the chart
2432     * in PNG format.
2433     *
2434     * @param w  the width for the saved image (if less than or equal to zero,
2435     *      the panel width will be used);
2436     * @param h  the height for the PNG image (if less than or equal to zero,
2437     *      the panel height will be used);
2438     *
2439     * @throws IOException if there is an I/O error.
2440     */
2441    public void doSaveAs(int w, int h) throws IOException {
2442        JFileChooser fileChooser = new JFileChooser();
2443        fileChooser.setCurrentDirectory(this.defaultDirectoryForSaveAs);
2444        FileNameExtensionFilter filter = new FileNameExtensionFilter(
2445                    localizationResources.getString("PNG_Image_Files"), "png");
2446        fileChooser.addChoosableFileFilter(filter);
2447        fileChooser.setFileFilter(filter);
2448
2449        int option = fileChooser.showSaveDialog(this);
2450        if (option == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
2451            String filename = fileChooser.getSelectedFile().getPath();
2452            if (isEnforceFileExtensions()) {
2453                if (!filename.endsWith(".png")) {
2454                    filename = filename + ".png";
2455                }
2456            }
2457            if (w <= 0) {
2458                w = getWidth();
2459            }
2460            if (h <= 0) {
2461                h = getHeight();
2462            }
2463            ChartUtils.saveChartAsPNG(new File(filename), this.chart, w, h);
2464        }
2465    }
2466    
2467    /**
2468     * Saves the chart in SVG format (a filechooser will be displayed so that
2469     * the user can specify the filename).  Note that this method only works
2470     * if the JFreeSVG library is on the classpath...if this library is not 
2471     * present, the method will fail.
2472     *
2473     * @param f  the file.
2474     *
2475     * @throws IOException if there is an exception.
2476     */
2477    protected void saveAsSVG(File f) throws IOException {
2478        File file = f;
2479        if (file == null) {
2480            JFileChooser fileChooser = new JFileChooser();
2481            fileChooser.setCurrentDirectory(this.defaultDirectoryForSaveAs);
2482            FileNameExtensionFilter filter = new FileNameExtensionFilter(
2483                    localizationResources.getString("SVG_Files"), "svg");
2484            fileChooser.addChoosableFileFilter(filter);
2485            fileChooser.setFileFilter(filter);
2486
2487            int option = fileChooser.showSaveDialog(this);
2488            if (option == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
2489                String filename = fileChooser.getSelectedFile().getPath();
2490                if (isEnforceFileExtensions()) {
2491                    if (!filename.endsWith(".svg")) {
2492                        filename = filename + ".svg";
2493                    }
2494                }
2495                file = new File(filename);
2496                if (file.exists()) {
2497                    String fileExists = localizationResources.getString(
2498                            "FILE_EXISTS_CONFIRM_OVERWRITE");
2499                    int response = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this, 
2500                            fileExists,
2501                            localizationResources.getString("Save_as_SVG"),
2502                            JOptionPane.OK_CANCEL_OPTION);
2503                    if (response == JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION) {
2504                        file = null;
2505                    }
2506                }
2507            }
2508        }
2509        
2510        if (file != null) {
2511            // use reflection to get the SVG string
2512            String svg = generateSVG(getWidth(), getHeight());
2513            BufferedWriter writer = null;
2514            Exception originalException = null;
2515            try {
2516                writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
2517                writer.write("<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.1//EN\" \"http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/1.1/DTD/svg11.dtd\">\n");
2518                writer.write(svg + "\n");
2519                writer.flush();
2520            } catch (Exception e) {
2521                originalException = e;
2522            }
2523            try {
2524                if (writer != null) {
2525                    writer.close();
2526                }
2527            } catch (IOException ex) {
2528                RuntimeException th = new RuntimeException(ex);
2529                if (originalException != null)
2530                    th.addSuppressed(originalException);
2531                throw th;
2532            }
2533        }
2534    }
2535    
2536    /**
2537     * Generates a string containing a rendering of the chart in SVG format.
2538     * This feature is only supported if the JFreeSVG library is included on 
2539     * the classpath.
2540     * 
2541     * @param width  the width.
2542     * @param height  the height.
2543     *
2544     * @return A string containing an SVG element for the current chart, or
2545     *     {@code null} if there is a problem with the method invocation
2546     *     by reflection.
2547     */
2548    protected String generateSVG(int width, int height) {
2549        Graphics2D g2 = createSVGGraphics2D(width, height);
2550        if (g2 == null) {
2551            throw new IllegalStateException("JFreeSVG library is not present.");
2552        }
2553        // we suppress shadow generation, because SVG is a vector format and
2554        // the shadow effect is applied via bitmap effects...
2555        g2.setRenderingHint(JFreeChart.KEY_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_GENERATION, true);
2556        String svg = null;
2557        Rectangle2D drawArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(0, 0, width, height);
2558        this.chart.draw(g2, drawArea);
2559        try {
2560            Method m = g2.getClass().getMethod("getSVGElement");
2561            svg = (String) m.invoke(g2);
2562        } catch (NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | IllegalAccessException |
2563                IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException e) {
2564            // null will be returned
2565        }
2566        return svg;
2567    }
2568
2569    /**
2570     * Creates an {@code SVGGraphics2D} instance (from JFreeSVG) using reflection.
2571     * If JFreeSVG is not on the classpath, this method returns {@code null}.
2572     *
2573     * @param w  the width.
2574     * @param h  the height.
2575     *
2576     * @return An {@code SVGGraphics2D} instance or {@code null}.
2577     */
2578    protected Graphics2D createSVGGraphics2D(int w, int h) {
2579        try {
2580            Class<?> svgGraphics2d = Class.forName("org.jfree.graphics2d.svg.SVGGraphics2D");
2581            Constructor<?> ctor = svgGraphics2d.getConstructor(int.class, int.class);
2582            return (Graphics2D) ctor.newInstance(w, h);
2583        } catch (ClassNotFoundException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | InstantiationException |
2584                IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException ex) {
2585            return null;
2586        }
2587    }
2588
2589    /**
2590     * Saves the chart in PDF format (a filechooser will be displayed so that
2591     * the user can specify the filename).  Note that this method only works
2592     * if the OrsonPDF library is on the classpath...if this library is not
2593     * present, the method will fail.
2594     *
2595     * @param f  the file.
2596     */
2597    protected void saveAsPDF(File f) {
2598        File file = f;
2599        if (file == null) {
2600            JFileChooser fileChooser = new JFileChooser();
2601            fileChooser.setCurrentDirectory(this.defaultDirectoryForSaveAs);
2602            FileNameExtensionFilter filter = new FileNameExtensionFilter(
2603                    localizationResources.getString("PDF_Files"), "pdf");
2604            fileChooser.addChoosableFileFilter(filter);
2605            fileChooser.setFileFilter(filter);
2606
2607            int option = fileChooser.showSaveDialog(this);
2608            if (option == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
2609                String filename = fileChooser.getSelectedFile().getPath();
2610                if (isEnforceFileExtensions()) {
2611                    if (!filename.endsWith(".pdf")) {
2612                        filename = filename + ".pdf";
2613                    }
2614                }
2615                file = new File(filename);
2616                if (file.exists()) {
2617                    String fileExists = localizationResources.getString(
2618                            "FILE_EXISTS_CONFIRM_OVERWRITE");
2619                    int response = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this, 
2620                            fileExists,
2621                            localizationResources.getString("Save_as_PDF"),
2622                            JOptionPane.OK_CANCEL_OPTION);
2623                    if (response == JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION) {
2624                        file = null;
2625                    }
2626                }
2627            }
2628        }
2629        
2630        if (file != null) {
2631            writeAsPDF(file, getWidth(), getHeight());
2632        }
2633    }
2634
2635    /**
2636     * Writes the current chart to the specified file in PDF format.  This 
2637     * will only work when the OrsonPDF library is found on the classpath.
2638     * Reflection is used to ensure there is no compile-time dependency on
2639     * OrsonPDF (which is non-free software).
2640     * 
2641     * @param file  the output file ({@code null} not permitted).
2642     * @param w  the chart width.
2643     * @param h  the chart height.
2644     */
2645    private void writeAsPDF(File file, int w, int h) {
2646        if (!ChartUtils.isOrsonPDFAvailable()) {
2647            throw new IllegalStateException(
2648                    "OrsonPDF is not present on the classpath.");
2649        }
2650        Args.nullNotPermitted(file, "file");
2651        try {
2652            Class<?> pdfDocClass = Class.forName("com.orsonpdf.PDFDocument");
2653            Object pdfDoc = pdfDocClass.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
2654            Method m = pdfDocClass.getMethod("createPage", Rectangle2D.class);
2655            Rectangle2D rect = new Rectangle(w, h);
2656            Object page = m.invoke(pdfDoc, rect);
2657            Method m2 = page.getClass().getMethod("getGraphics2D");
2658            Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) m2.invoke(page);
2659            // we suppress shadow generation, because PDF is a vector format and
2660            // the shadow effect is applied via bitmap effects...
2661            g2.setRenderingHint(JFreeChart.KEY_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_GENERATION, true);
2662            Rectangle2D drawArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(0, 0, w, h);
2663            this.chart.draw(g2, drawArea);
2664            Method m3 = pdfDocClass.getMethod("writeToFile", File.class);
2665            m3.invoke(pdfDoc, file);
2666        } catch (ClassNotFoundException | InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException |
2667                NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | IllegalArgumentException |
2668                InvocationTargetException ex) {
2669            throw new RuntimeException(ex);
2670        }
2671    }
2672
2673    /**
2674     * Creates a print job for the chart.
2675     */
2676    public void createChartPrintJob() {
2677        PrinterJob job = PrinterJob.getPrinterJob();
2678        PageFormat pf = job.defaultPage();
2679        PageFormat pf2 = job.pageDialog(pf);
2680        if (pf2 != pf) {
2681            job.setPrintable(this, pf2);
2682            if (job.printDialog()) {
2683                try {
2684                    job.print();
2685                }
2686                catch (PrinterException e) {
2687                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, e);
2688                }
2689            }
2690        }
2691    }
2692
2693    /**
2694     * Prints the chart on a single page.
2695     *
2696     * @param g  the graphics context.
2697     * @param pf  the page format to use.
2698     * @param pageIndex  the index of the page. If not {@code 0}, nothing
2699     *                   gets printed.
2700     *
2701     * @return The result of printing.
2702     */
2703    @Override
2704    public int print(Graphics g, PageFormat pf, int pageIndex) {
2705
2706        if (pageIndex != 0) {
2707            return NO_SUCH_PAGE;
2708        }
2709        Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) g;
2710        double x = pf.getImageableX();
2711        double y = pf.getImageableY();
2712        double w = pf.getImageableWidth();
2713        double h = pf.getImageableHeight();
2714        this.chart.draw(g2, new Rectangle2D.Double(x, y, w, h), this.anchor,
2715                null);
2716        return PAGE_EXISTS;
2717
2718    }
2719
2720    /**
2721     * Adds a listener to the list of objects listening for chart mouse events.
2722     *
2723     * @param listener  the listener ({@code null} not permitted).
2724     */
2725    public void addChartMouseListener(ChartMouseListener listener) {
2726        Args.nullNotPermitted(listener, "listener");
2727        this.chartMouseListeners.add(ChartMouseListener.class, listener);
2728    }
2729
2730    /**
2731     * Removes a listener from the list of objects listening for chart mouse
2732     * events.
2733     *
2734     * @param listener  the listener.
2735     */
2736    public void removeChartMouseListener(ChartMouseListener listener) {
2737        this.chartMouseListeners.remove(ChartMouseListener.class, listener);
2738    }
2739
2740    /**
2741     * Returns an array of the listeners of the given type registered with the
2742     * panel.
2743     *
2744     * @param listenerType  the listener type.
2745     *
2746     * @return An array of listeners.
2747     */
2748    @Override
2749    public <T extends EventListener> T[] getListeners(Class<T> listenerType) {
2750        if (listenerType == ChartMouseListener.class) {
2751            // fetch listeners from local storage
2752            return this.chartMouseListeners.getListeners(listenerType);
2753        }
2754        else {
2755            return super.getListeners(listenerType);
2756        }
2757    }
2758
2759    /**
2760     * Creates a popup menu for the panel.  This method includes code that
2761     * auto-detects JFreeSVG and OrsonPDF (via reflection) and, if they are
2762     * present (and the {@code save} argument is {@code true}, adds a menu item
2763     * for each.
2764     *
2765     * @param properties  include a menu item for the chart property editor.
2766     * @param copy include a menu item for copying to the clipboard.
2767     * @param save  include one or more menu items for saving the chart to
2768     *     supported image formats.
2769     * @param print  include a menu item for printing the chart.
2770     * @param zoom  include menu items for zooming.
2771     *
2772     * @return The popup menu.
2773     */
2774    protected JPopupMenu createPopupMenu(boolean properties,
2775            boolean copy, boolean save, boolean print, boolean zoom) {
2776
2777        return chartPanelProduct.createPopupMenu(properties, copy, save, print, zoom, this);
2778
2779    }
2780
2781    /**
2782     * The idea is to modify the zooming options depending on the type of chart
2783     * being displayed by the panel.
2784     *
2785     * @param x  horizontal position of the popup.
2786     * @param y  vertical position of the popup.
2787     */
2788    protected void displayPopupMenu(int x, int y) {
2789
2790        chartPanelProduct.displayPopupMenu(x, y, this.popup, this.chart, this);
2791
2792    }
2793
2794    /**
2795     * Updates the UI for a LookAndFeel change.
2796     */
2797    @Override
2798    public void updateUI() {
2799        // here we need to update the UI for the popup menu, if the panel
2800        // has one...
2801        if (this.popup != null) {
2802            SwingUtilities.updateComponentTreeUI(this.popup);
2803        }
2804        super.updateUI();
2805    }
2806
2807    /**
2808     * Provides serialization support.
2809     *
2810     * @param stream  the output stream.
2811     *
2812     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
2813     */
2814    protected void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
2815        stream.defaultWriteObject();
2816    }
2817
2818    /**
2819     * Provides serialization support.
2820     *
2821     * @param stream  the input stream.
2822     *
2823     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
2824     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
2825     */
2826    protected void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
2827        throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
2828        stream.defaultReadObject();
2829
2830        // we create a new but empty chartMouseListeners list
2831        this.chartMouseListeners = new EventListenerList();
2832
2833        // register as a listener with sub-components...
2834        if (this.chart != null) {
2835            this.chart.addChangeListener(this);
2836        }
2837
2838    }
2839
2840        /**
2841         * Handle the case where a plot implements the  {@link Zoomable}  interface.
2842         * @param zoomable   the zoomable plot.
2843         * @param e   the mouse wheel event.
2844         * @param zoomFactor
2845         */
2846        public void handleZoomable(Zoomable zoomable, MouseWheelEvent e, double zoomFactor) {
2847                ChartRenderingInfo info = getChartRenderingInfo();
2848                PlotRenderingInfo pinfo = info.getPlotInfo();
2849                Point2D p = translateScreenToJava2D(e.getPoint());
2850                if (!pinfo.getDataArea().contains(p)) {
2851                        return;
2852                }
2853                Plot plot = (Plot) zoomable;
2854                boolean notifyState = plot.isNotify();
2855                plot.setNotify(false);
2856                int clicks = e.getWheelRotation();
2857                double zf = 1.0 + zoomFactor;
2858                if (clicks < 0) {
2859                        zf = 1.0 / zf;
2860                }
2861                if (isDomainZoomable()) {
2862                        zoomable.zoomDomainAxes(zf, pinfo, p, true);
2863                }
2864                if (isRangeZoomable()) {
2865                        zoomable.zoomRangeAxes(zf, pinfo, p, true);
2866                }
2867                plot.setNotify(notifyState);
2868        }
2869
2870}
2871
